fr.laple.controller.exercises

Class ExerciseParameterizerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.laple.controller.exercises.ExerciseParameterizerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ExerciseParameterizerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener
    This class is the controller for the ExerciseParamaterizerView
    Author:
    anthonyrey
    See Also:
    ExerciseParameterizerView

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Here two cases : - Back : get back to the root view defined in RooData Object (Will do DB stuff) - Ok : Create an exercise according to DB data (the symbols you know)
      void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent e)
      If you change the value of the symbol mode combo or the question mode, we re update the values
      private void setComboBoxes()
      Set the comboBoxes to the values of the symbol container modes (hiragana etc..)
      private void setSolverCombo()
      Remove the incompatible answers modes according to the set question mode
      private void setSolverMaxValue()
      Set the upper limit for the exercise count

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setComboBoxes

        private void setComboBoxes()
        Set the comboBoxes to the values of the symbol container modes (hiragana etc..) Then set the ExercisesModes and finally call setSolverCombo and setSolverMaxValue

      • setSolverCombo

        private void setSolverCombo()
        Remove the incompatible answers modes according to the set question mode

      • setSolverMaxValue

        private void setSolverMaxValue()
        Set the upper limit for the exercise count

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Here two cases : - Back : get back to the root view defined in RooData Object (Will do DB stuff) - Ok : Create an exercise according to DB data (the symbols you know)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - An ActionEvent Object
        See Also:
        RootData

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent e)
        If you change the value of the symbol mode combo or the question mode, we re update the values
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
